nl.esciencecenter.octopus.files

Class RelativePath

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.esciencecenter.octopus.files.RelativePath

  • public class RelativePath
extends Object
    RelativePath contains a sequence of path elements separated by a separator.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jason Maassen

        The default separator to use.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RelativePath

        public RelativePath()
        Create a new empty RelativePath using the default separator.

      • RelativePath

        public RelativePath(String path)
        Create a new RelativePath using the path and the default separator. If the path is null or an empty String, the resulting RelativePath is empty.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to use.

      • RelativePath

        public RelativePath(String... elements)
        Create a new RelativePath using the given path elements and the default separator. If the elements is null or an empty String array, the resulting RelativePath is empty.
        Parameters:
        elements - the path elements to use.

      • RelativePath

        public RelativePath(RelativePath... paths)
        Create a new RelativePath by appending the provided paths. If the paths is null the resulting RelativePath is empty.
        Parameters:
        paths - the path elements to use.

      • RelativePath

        public RelativePath(char separator,
            String... elements)
        Create a new RelativePath using the given path elements and the separator. If the elements is null or an empty String array, the resulting RelativePath is empty. Otherwise, each of the elements will be parsed individually, splitting them into elements wherever a separator is encountered. Elements that are null or contain an empty string are ignored.
        Parameters:
        elements - the path elements to use.
        separator - the separator to use.

    • Method Detail

      • getFileName

        Get the file name, or null if the RelativePath is empty.
        Returns:
        the resulting file name or null.

        public RelativePath getParent()
        Get the parent path, or null if this path does not have a parent.
        Returns:
        a path representing the path's parent.

      • getNameCount

        public int getNameCount()
        Get the number of name elements in the path.
        Returns:
        the number of elements in the path, or 0 if this is empty.

      • getNames

        public String[] getNames()
        Get the number of name elements in the path.
        Returns:
        the number of elements in the path, or 0 if this path is empty.

      • getName

        public String getName(int index)
        Get a name element of this path.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the element
        Returns:
        the name element
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the index is negative or greater or equal to the number of elements in the path.

      • subpath

        public RelativePath subpath(int beginIndex,
                   int endIndex)
        Returns a RelativePath that is a subsequence of the name elements of this path.
        Parameters:
        beginIndex - the index of the first element, inclusive
        endIndex - the index of the last element, exclusive
        Returns:
        a new AbsolutePath that is a subsequence of the name elements in this path.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the beginIndex or endIndex is negative or greater or equal to the number of elements in the path, or if beginIndex is larger that or equal to the endIndex.

      • startsWith

        public boolean startsWith(RelativePath other)
        Tests if this path starts with the given path.
        Parameters:
        other - the path to test.
        Returns:
        If this paths start with the other path.

      • endsWith

        public boolean endsWith(RelativePath other)
        Tests if this path ends with the given path.
        Parameters:
        other - the path to test.
        Returns:
        If this paths ends with the other path.

      • resolve

        public RelativePath resolve(RelativePath other)
        Resolve a RelativePath against this path. If other represents an empty path, this path is returned. If this path is empty, the other path is returned. Otherwise, a new RelativePath is returned that contains the concatenation of the path elements this path and the other path.
        Parameters:
        other - the RelativePath.

      • resolve

        public RelativePath resolve(String other)
        Resolve a String containing a RelativePath against this path. If other represents an empty path, this path is returned. If this path is empty, a RelativePath representing the other path is returned. Otherwise, a new RelativePath is returned that contains the concatenation of the path elements this path and the other path.
        Parameters:
        other - the RelativePath.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Is this path empty ?
        Returns:
        If this path is empty.

      • resolveSibling

        public RelativePath resolveSibling(RelativePath other)
        Resolves the given path to this paths parent path, thereby creating a sibling to this path. TODO: semantics ???
        Parameters:
        other - the path to resolve as sibling.
        Returns:
        a RelativePath representing the sibling.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the path can not be resolved as a sibling to this path.

      • relativize

        public RelativePath relativize(RelativePath other)
                        throws IllegalArgumentException
        Create a relative path between the given path and this path. TODO: explain.
        Parameters:
        other - the path to relativize.
        Returns:
        a RelativePath representing a relative path between the given path and this path.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the path can not be relativized to this path.

      • iterator

        public Iterator<RelativePath> iterator()
        Create an Iterator that returns all possible sub paths of this path, in order of increasing length. For example, for the path "/a/b/c/d" the iterator returns "/a", "/a/b", "a/b/c", "/a/b/c/d".
        Returns:

      • getPath

        public String getPath()
        Get a string representation of this path.
        Returns:
        a string representation of this path.

      • normalize

        public RelativePath normalize()
        Normalize this RelativePath by removing as many redundant path elements as possible. Redundant path elements are "." (indicating the current directory) and ".." (indicating the parent directory). Note that the resulting normalized path does may still contain ".." elements which are not redundant.
        Returns:
        the normalize path.
